profile.description:
As a software tester rooted in best QA practices, I am highly capable 
of learning new software and technologies quickly, while ensuring that
software is successfully and thoroughly tested for production
implementation. With a dedication to quality, automation, a
passion for foreign and computer languages, I would be an asset
to your company. As an exceptional self-starter, I have
the confidence to build any kind of testing framework from scratch
with confidence.

item0.description: Created a custom automated testing framework from scratch in Python for a multi-app platform container application with Selenium, Requests (Python API), Docker (container testing), and hooked up the testing pipeline with Jenkins to run in a testing lab. Currently adding new functionalities to said framework as well as adding new automated test cases, maintaining old ones for better testing coverage.

item1.description: Created an object-oriented automated web testing framework from scratch with Selenium, and a custom Selenium API test addition for Swagger API in C#. Maintain testing framework. Perform development to maintain internal support application (C# ASP.Net) Maintain testing pipeline in DevOps during each release for test results and issues.

item2.description: Contributed to the creation of C# framework and maintained this automated framework using C#, Selenium and BDD in SpecFlow/Gherkin. Built and maintained tests using C# framework using Visual Studio. Found software bugs and tracked stories through VSTS using Agile methodology.

item3.description: Created, and maintained automated tests using customized C# and JavaScript framework with MTM, and TFS to test the flow of data in the MongoDB database and web services (REST). Documented, tracked, and reviewed test plans, cases, test results and anomalies found during product testing with Microsoft TFS, and MTM

item1.description: Information Technology & supplemental Programming and Database courses

item2.institution: Ashford University (Now The University of Arizona Global Campus)
item2.description: Major in Mathematics with Mathematical Computing as terminal area.

tools: selenium, familiarity with cypress, robot, etc.
gherkin language for BDD (specflow, cucumber, etc.)
github, understanding of docker, jenkins, azure, etc.
extra_skills: API, database testing (SQL and noSQL i.e. MongoDB)
